Ideator Unveils New Technology in Platform Release
New Features Make It Easier to Bring Business Ideas to Life
San Diego, CA, August 26, 2015 --( PR.com )-- In response to the needs of its growing user base, Ideator, a web-based company devoted to fostering global innovation and entrepreneurship, announces the release of several new features designed to enhance its technology platform. The upgrade will allow Ideator members to more easily capture and share business ideas while connecting with the people and resources they need to grow their businesses.
“At Ideator, we use technology to connect entrepreneurs around the world with experienced business leaders,” says Co-Founder Charlie Smith. “ We’re all about helping entrepreneurs find and connect with the people who have the experience and expertise they need to grow their businesses, and our new release will make it easier for our members to do that.”
Ideator’s new technology, accessible on www.Ideator.com , will enable entrepreneurs to:
Create and view enhanced profiles. More detailed profiles of Ideator team members, advisors and investors will make it easier for entrepreneurs to identify the people who have the expertise they need. Profiles will provide information on industry experience, areas of interest, specific skill sets, and other professional information. Members can also create profiles showcasing their own skills if they want to attract interest from existing teams rather than starting their own.
Access a new resources portal. Ideator gathers recommendations for business tools and resources, and now makes them available in one centralized portal. Entrepreneurs can access ideas and information on how to secure a company name, get help creating a pitch deck, obtain funding, evaluate financial management tools, and more.
Collect business ideas. Ideator members hosting a competition for business ideas can use the platform’s new Collections feature to gather and manage idea submissions.
Engage in discussions with trustworthy sources. Ideator now also offers a discussion board – moderated by members of the Ideator team – to provide credible information on various business startup topics. Members can review current discussions and ask specific questions related to their business startups.
“Ideator is helping people to build businesses, create jobs, give back to communities, and follow their dreams – from anywhere in the world,” adds Co-Founder Jeremy Sanders. “We do this by helping them navigate the often complex and difficult process of starting a business from scratch. All it takes is an idea and internet access, and Ideator can help anyone build a business.”
About Ideator
Ideator is building a global community that helps passionate people with great ideas, of all ages, genders, and backgrounds, to connect with the resources needed to execute successfully.
